-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.title: 7 Best Documentaries You Can Watch On Netflix
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.meta_description: Here are some of the best documentary films you can find on Netflix right now.
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.content:
7 Best Documentaries You Can Watch On Netflix

7 Best Documentaries You Can Watch On Netflix

If you're looking for some great documentaries to watch on Netflix, you're in luck!

Netflix offers a wide range of documentaries that cover various topics and interests. From social issues to music legends, there is something for everyone to enjoy. Here is a list of some of the best documentaries available on Netflix that you should add to your watchlist:

1. 13th (2016)

- IMDb: 8.2
- Rotten Tomatoes: 97%

13th 

"13th" is a powerful documentary that explores the intersection of race, justice, and mass incarceration in the United States. Directed by Ava DuVernay, the film delves into the history of racial inequality within the U.S. prison system and how it reflects broader societal issues. Through interviews and archival footage, "13th" sheds light on the impact of slavery, Jim Crow laws, and the war on drugs on the disproportionately high rates of incarceration among African Americans.

2. The Greatest Night in Pop (2024)

- IMDb: 7.9
- Rotten Tomatoes: 98%

The Greatest Night in Pop

"The Greatest Night in Pop" is a documentary that delves into the making of the iconic song "We Are The World" in 1985. This documentary takes viewers back to a historic moment in music history when some of the biggest names in the music industry came together to record a song aimed at raising funds for African famine relief. Through interviews and footage, viewers witness the collaborative effort behind this iconic anthem and its lasting impact on music and humanitarianism.

- IMDb: 7.7
- Rotten Tomatoes: 85%

3. The Deepest Breath (2023)

The Deepest Breath

"The Deepest Breath" is a riveting documentary about two extraordinary individuals in the world of freediving: Italian prodigy Alessia Zecchini and adventurous Irish safety diver Stephen Keenan. Directed by Laura McGann, the film explores their pursuit of underwater dreams amidst the psychological and physical challenges of the sport. Through stunning footage and intimate interviews, viewers are drawn into their captivating journey of passion, ambition, and, ultimately, tragedy.

4. Trainwreck: Woodstock '99 (2022)

- IMDb: 7.4
- Rotten Tomatoes: 88%

Trainwreck: Woodstock '99

"Trainwreck: Woodstock '99" is a gripping documentary that tells the story of the infamous troubled music festival, Woodstock 1999. It shows how the event, meant for fun, turned chaotic due to poor planning and mistreatment of attendees. Through interviews and footage, the film reveals the escalating tensions and eventual chaos that unfolded over the festival's duration.

5. The Tinder Swindler (2022)

- IMDb: 7.1
- Rotten Tomatoes: 97%

The Tinder Swindler

"The Tinder Swindler" is a gripping documentary that follows the true story of a man who deceived women on dating apps for financial gain. Through interviews with victims and experts, the film exposes the manipulation and deception behind the man's elaborate schemes. "The Tinder Swindler" sheds light on the darker side of online dating and the importance of being cautious when forming connections in the digital age.

6. Virunga (2014)

- IMDb: 8.1
- Rotten Tomatoes: 100%

Virunga

"Virunga" takes viewers to the heart of Africa's oldest national park, where a team of rangers works tirelessly to protect endangered gorillas from poachers and armed militias. The documentary showcases the challenges and dangers faced by those fighting to preserve the park's wildlife and natural resources. Through stunning cinematography and emotional storytelling, "Virunga" highlights the importance of conservation efforts in the face of greed and conflict.

7. Sr. (2022)

- IMDb: 7.2
- Rotten Tomatoes: 97%

Sr.

"Sr." (2022) is a heartfelt documentary directed by Chris Smith, featuring Robert Downey Jr. paying tribute to his late father, pioneering filmmaker Robert Downey Sr. The film offers a tender yet irreverent account of Downey Sr.'s fearless and visionary career, which set the standard for countercultural comedy in the 1960s and 1970s. Through interviews and archival footage, viewers gain insight into the close relationship between father and son, as well as Downey Sr.'s enduring impact on cinema.

-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.title: The 8 Most Beautiful Places in Wyoming You Should Explore on Your Next Trip
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.meta_description: From the famous Yellowstone National Park to the towering Devil's Tower, here are some of the most beautiful in Wyoming that will amaze you.
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.meta_keywords: most beautiful places in Wyoming,places to visit in Wyoming
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.content:
The 8 Most Beautiful Places in Wyoming You Should Explore on Your Next Trip

Are you looking for your next place to explore? Why don't you visit some of the most beautiful places in Wyoming? Wyoming is an excellent choice if you love nature, breathtaking views, and peaceful surroundings. There are a lot of breathtaking places in this state that will amaze you.

Wyoming is famous for its stunning natural beauty. It has everything from mountains and forests to rivers and hot springs. Whether you enjoy hiking, sightseeing, or simply relaxing, you will find something to love here.

In this article, we will take a closer look at the most beautiful places in Wyoming. These are must-visit destinations for anyone who loves exploring nature. Let's dive in!

1. Grand Teton National Park

Grand Teton National Park is one of the most famous places in Wyoming. It is known for its towering mountain peaks, clear blue lakes, and lush green valleys. You can hike the many trails, go boating on Jackson Lake, or simply enjoy the breathtaking views of the Teton Range. Wildlife enthusiasts will also love the chance to spot moose, bears, elk, and eagles in their natural habitats.

2. Devil's Tower National Monument

This striking rock formation is a must-see destination. Devil's Tower rises dramatically over 800 feet from the surrounding plains, making it an iconic landmark. It holds spiritual significance for Native American tribes, and you can learn about its history and legends at the visitor center. The paved trail around the base offers fantastic views of the formation and the surrounding landscape. Rock climbers often come here to tackle its challenging walls, but even non-climbers will be awed by its unique beauty.

3. Yellowstone National Park

Yellowstone is the world's first national park and one of Wyoming's greatest treasures. It is home to famous geysers like Old Faithful, colorful hot springs like Grand Prismatic Spring, and stunning waterfalls such as the Lower Falls of the Yellowstone River. The park's vast wilderness is a haven for wildlife, including bison, elk, bears, and wolves. You can enjoy hiking, camping, or simply driving through the park's scenic routes. With its diverse landscapes and geothermal wonders, Yellowstone offers endless opportunities for adventure.

4. Bighorn National Forest

Bighorn National Forest is a perfect destination for nature lovers who enjoy forests, mountains, and pristine wilderness. This area is filled with hiking trails that lead to alpine meadows, crystal-clear lakes, and panoramic mountain views. The Cloud Peak Skyway, a scenic drive through the forest, offers incredible sights of the Bighorn Mountains. Camping and fishing are also popular activities here. Whether you're exploring on foot or by car, this forest will leave you with unforgettable memories of Wyoming's natural beauty.

5. Cody

Cody is a charming town that captures the spirit of the Wild West. Named after Buffalo Bill Cody, it offers a mix of history, culture, and outdoor adventure. Visit the Buffalo Bill Center of the West, a collection of five museums showcasing art, history, and the Old West. The town also hosts nightly rodeos in the summer, which are fun for the whole family. With its friendly atmosphere and proximity to Yellowstone National Park, Cody is an ideal base for exploring the region.

6. Medicine Bow National Forest

This forest is a paradise for outdoor enthusiasts, offering high peaks, sparkling lakes, and peaceful trails. Medicine Bow Peak, the highest point in the Snowy Range, is a favorite spot for hikers seeking stunning views. In the summer, the forest is filled with colorful wildflowers, while autumn brings vibrant foliage. The area is also great for fishing, camping, and photography. Medicine Bow National Forest is a tranquil escape for anyone looking to connect with nature.

7. Hot Springs State Park

Hot Springs State Park is famous for its soothing, mineral-rich waters. The park features several soaking pools where visitors can relax and enjoy the therapeutic benefits of the hot springs. A walking trail leads to the colorful terraces formed by the mineral deposits. The park is also home to a free-roaming bison herd, which adds to its unique charm. Whether you're visiting for relaxation or exploration, this park offers a one-of-a-kind experience in Wyoming.

8. Flaming Gorge National Recreation Area

Flaming Gorge is a breathtaking area known for its vibrant red cliffs and deep blue reservoir. The area is perfect for outdoor activities such as boating, fishing, and camping. Hikers and photographers will love the dramatic landscapes and scenic viewpoints, especially at sunrise and sunset. The reservoir is also a popular spot for water sports like kayaking and paddleboarding. With its stunning natural beauty and endless recreational opportunities, Flaming Gorge is a must-visit destination for adventure seekers.

Top 5 Rarest Ferrari In The World

Top 5 Rarest Ferrari In The World

The world of sports cars is a fascinating one, filled with sleek designs, powerful engines, and a rich history. When it comes to rare and exclusive vehicles, Ferrari is a name that often comes to mind.

Among the many models produced by the iconic Italian brand, there are some that stand out for their rarity and unique characteristics. Let's take a closer look at five of the rarest Ferrari cars in the world.

1. 1966 Ferrari 365 P Berlinetta Speciale

Ferrari 365 P Berlinetta Speciale

This stunning model was a concept car made by Pininfarina and Ferrari. The 365 P Berlinetta Speciale features a central driving position, a three-seat arrangement, and a distinctive body design that sets it apart from other Ferraris of its time. With its sleek lines and powerful engine, this car is a true collector's item.

2. 1966 Ferrari F50 GT

Ferrari F50 GT1

The Ferrari F50 GT1 is a rare racing version of the iconic F50 road car. With only three units ever produced, this model is highly sought after by collectors and racing enthusiasts alike. Its aggressive styling and impressive performance make it a standout in the world of sports cars.

Ferrari 330 P4

Considered one of the most beautiful racing cars ever built, the Ferrari 330 P4 is a true classic. With only four units ever made, this model is a highly coveted piece of automotive history. Ferrari 288 GTO Evoluzione

The Ferrari 288 GTO Evoluzione is a rare and special version of the iconic 288 GTO supercar. With only five units ever produced, this model is a true collector's dream. Its improved aerodynamics, enhanced performance, and racing-inspired design make it a standout among rare Ferraris.

-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.title: McDonald's Restaurant Abandoned Since 1994 Found in Shocking Condition
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.meta_description: McDonald's Restaurant Abandoned Since 1994 Found in Shocking Condition
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.content:
McDonald's Restaurant Abandoned Since 1994 Found in Shocking Condition

McDonald's Restaurant Abandoned since 1994 Found in Shocking Condition

YouTuber Chris Luckhardt discovered a McDonald's restaurant abandoned in 1994 on Adak Island in the US state of Alaska.

According to World Population Review, Adak Island has a population of 154.

On this old McD's menu are "dino-sized fries" which may be related to the movie Jurassic Park (1993).

Quoted from the New York Post on Tuesday (27/2), Happy Meals contains Bobby's World Toys, an animated series from 1990 to 1998.

According to the prices listed on this old-school menu, a Big Mac costs US$2.45, a Big Mac package costs US$4.59, six-piece McNuggets are priced at US$2.35, a Happy Meal is US$3.36, and an egg McMuffin can be purchased for US$1.95.

Now, the Big Mac package-including a burger, fries, and a drink-has risen to US$18 at some McDonald's outlets in the "Land of Uncle Sam".

McDonald's even reported an increase in revenue that was directly affected by the price increase in the strategic menu, but the price may vary by location.

David Klyman, a financial strategist at Klyman Financial, explained to HuffPost, "The price of items sold at McDonald's is related to inflation, as well as commercial property prices, fuel prices, interest rates, car prices, health insurance costs, the cost of flights at the time. You have to fly food across the country, and more."

Apart from regional economic factors such as minimum wage, property taxes, rental fees, and other items, franchisors are also free to set their own prices, further complicating menu comparisons.

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Chris Luckhardt (@chrisluckhardt)

McDonald's corporate website states, "McDonald's prices vary by location. Ninety percent of McDonald's restaurants are independently owned and operated by franchisees, who are authorized to set their own prices."

-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.title: Easy Chimichurri Recipe: 4 Variations to Try at Home
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.meta_description: In this article, we will share the classic chimichurri recipe along with three other variations of the recipe.
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.meta_keywords: chimichurri recipe,how to make chimichurri,chimichurri sauce
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.content:
Easy Chimichurri Recipe: 4 Variations to Try at Home

Are you looking for a fresh, tasty sauce to add flavor to your meals? A chimichurri recipe is your answer. This classic sauce from Argentina is made with fresh herbs, garlic, oil, and vinegar. The bright green color and fresh taste of chimichurri make it a perfect match for many dishes.

The chimichurri recipe has become popular worldwide because it is easy to make and very versatile. You can use this sauce on grilled meats, fish, vegetables, or even as a salad dressing. Many people love chimichurri because it adds a fresh, herbal taste to any meal without using complex cooking methods.

In this article, we will share different chimichurri recipe variations that you can try at home. From the classic green version to red chimichurri, and even versions with cilantro and mint, you will find a recipe that suits your taste. We also include some tips to make the best chimichurri at home. We gathered these recipes and tips from various sources, Monday (6/1/2025).

Tips to Make Chimichurri

1. Use Fresh Ingredients: Always choose fresh herbs, garlic, and high-quality olive oil for the best taste. Avoid dried herbs, as they will not give the same vibrant flavor.

2. Chop Ingredients Finely: While some recipes use a blender, chopping the herbs and garlic by hand creates a better texture. It also helps the sauce look more authentic.

3. Balance the Flavors: Chimichurri should have a balance of tanginess, saltiness, and freshness. Taste the sauce as you make it, and adjust the seasoning if needed.

4. Let It Rest: Allow the sauce to sit for at least 20 minutes before serving. This helps the flavors blend together.

5. Store Properly: Chimichurri can be stored in an airtight container in the fridge for up to one week. Make sure to cover it with a thin layer of oil to prevent it from drying out.

Classic Chimichurri Recipe

Ingredients:

- 1 cup fresh parsley, finely chopped

- 4 garlic cloves, minced

- 1/2 cup olive oil

- 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar

- 1 teaspoon oregano (fresh or dried)

- 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes

- Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

1. Start by washing the parsley thoroughly and patting it dry. Finely chop the parsley and place it in a medium-sized bowl.

2. Mince the garlic cloves and add them to the bowl with the parsley. If using fresh oregano, chop it finely before adding it to the mixture.

3. Pour in the red wine vinegar and olive oil. Stir the ingredients together until they are well combined.

4. Add the red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper. Mix the sauce thoroughly and taste to adjust the seasoning if necessary.

5. Cover the bowl and let the chimichurri sit at room temperature for about 20 minutes. This resting time allows the flavors to meld together. Serve with grilled steak, chicken, or vegetables.

Red Chimichurri Recipe

Ingredients:

- 1 cup fresh parsley, finely chopped

- 2 garlic cloves, minced

- 1/4 cup olive oil

- 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar

- 1 tablespoon smoked paprika

- 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder

- Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

1. Begin by cleaning the parsley and chopping it finely. Place the parsley in a medium bowl.

2. Mince the garlic and add it to the bowl along with the smoked paprika and chili powder. Stir the dry ingredients until evenly distributed.

3. Slowly pour in the olive oil and red wine vinegar while stirring the mixture. Make sure everything is well combined.

4. Add salt and pepper to taste. If you prefer a spicier sauce, increase the amount of chili powder slightly.

5. Let the chimichurri rest for at least 20 minutes before serving. This will allow the flavors to develop fully. This red chimichurri is perfect for adding a smoky, spicy kick to grilled meats or roasted vegetables.

Cilantro Chimichurri Recipe

Ingredients:

- 1 cup fresh cilantro, finely chopped

- 2 garlic cloves, minced

- 1/2 cup olive oil

- 2 tablespoons lime juice

- 1 teaspoon ground cumin

- 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes

- Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

1. Rinse the cilantro thoroughly and pat it dry. Chop the cilantro leaves finely and place them in a bowl.

2. Mince the garlic and add it to the cilantro. Stir in the ground cumin, ensuring it is evenly distributed.

3. Squeeze the lime juice and pour it into the bowl along with the olive oil. Mix well to combine all the ingredients.

4. Add the red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper. Stir the sauce again and taste it to adjust the lime juice or seasoning as needed.

5. Cover and let the chimichurri sit for at least 20 minutes before serving. This cilantro chimichurri pairs wonderfully with seafood, chicken, or tacos.

Mint Chimichurri Recipe

Ingredients:

- 1 cup fresh mint leaves, finely chopped

- 1/2 cup fresh parsley, finely chopped

- 2 garlic cloves, minced

- 1/4 cup olive oil

- 2 tablespoons white vinegar

- 1 teaspoon sugar

- Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

1. Wash the mint leaves and parsley, then pat them dry. Finely chop both and place them in a mixing bowl.

2. Mince the garlic and add it to the bowl. Stir the herbs and garlic together until evenly combined.

3. Pour in the white vinegar and olive oil, mixing thoroughly to ensure the herbs are coated evenly.

4. Add the sugar, salt, and pepper. Stir the mixture well and taste it. Adjust the sugar if you prefer a slightly sweeter sauce.

5. Let the mint chimichurri rest for about 20 minutes at room temperature. This allows the flavors to blend. Serve with lamb, grilled vegetables, or as a dip.

-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.title: The 5 Oldest Temples in China: Exploring the Rich History and Timeless Beauty
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.meta_description: The 5 Oldest Temples in China: Exploring the Rich History and Timeless Beauty
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.content:
The 5 Oldest Temples in China: Exploring the Rich History and Timeless Beauty

China is a land with a deep spiritual heritage. It is home to numerous ancient temples that have stood the test of time. These holy sites serve as windows into the country's rich history, cultural traditions, and religious practices.

The 5 Oldest Temples in China: Exploring the Rich History and Timeless Beauty

In this article, we take a journey to discover the five oldest temples in China. Each temple has a unique history and unique attraction.

It ranges from calm mountain settings to complex architectural wonders. China's temples have become popular destinations. For those spiritual seekers and cultural lovers.

This is source 2

1. Shaolin Temple, Henan Province

The Shaolin Temple is not only one of China's oldest monasteries. But it also holds great value in the development of Chinese Buddhism and martial arts. In the 5th century, it was founded.

Shaolin Temple

It is located in the lush Song Mountains. This famous monastery is revered as the birthplace of Shaolin Kung Fu. It has historical and cultural significance. These have made it a popular pilgrimage site for Buddhists and a destination for martial arts fans from around the world.

2. White Horse Temple, Henan Province

Dating back to the 1st century, the White Horse Temple is considered the first Buddhist temple in China. Its origins were twisted with Buddhism's introduction to the country. Legend has it that two white horses carried holy Buddhist scriptures from India.

White Horse Temple

That led to the construction of this iconic temple. Today, visitors are delighted by the temple's peaceful atmosphere. Then you will marvel with ancient pagodas, and the amazing Hall of Mahavira. It is houses priceless Buddhist artifacts.

3. Kaiyuan Temple, Fujian Province

Kaiyuan Temple is famous for its incredible architecture and rich cultural heritage. Built in the 7th century during the Tang Dynasty. It is located in the historic city of Quanzhou. This monastery played a crucial role in spreading Buddhism to East Asia.

The temple's towering pagoda, detailed stone carvings, and calm courtyards. The works of art prove the rich history and artistic excellence of this country. Its popularity stems not only from its historical significance. It is also due to its harmonious combination with nature.

Kaiyuan Temple

4. Lingyin Temple, Zhejiang Province

Lingyin Temple is also known as the Temple of the Soul's Retreat. It is one of China's most respected Buddhist monasteries. With a history spanning over 1,600 years. Lingyin Temple is surrounded by lush forests and panoramic mountains. This calm place provides a peaceful escape from the bustling city of Hangzhou.

Lingyin Temple

The temple complex features incredible architecture. It includes the famous Grand Hall of the Great Sage. The site is decorated with detailed carvings and Buddhist statues. The beauty and spiritual comfort it provides are proof of its popularity.

5. Jokhang Temple, Tibet Autonomous Region

The Jokhang Temple is not only one of the oldest monasteries in China. It also holds great religious significance for Tibetan Buddhists. It is located in the heart of Lhasa. It was constructed in the 7th century.

Jokhang Temple

The Jokhang temple is home to the revered Jowo Rinpoche statue. It's believed to be a holy image of Buddha Shakyamuni. Pilgrims from all over the world visit this temple to see its architectural wonders. Visitors can experience Tibetan Buddhism's faith. Then engage themselves in the rich atmosphere of Barkhor Street.

In conclusion,

The five oldest monasteries in China offer a glimpse into the country's rich spiritual heritage, architectural, and cultural traditions. These religious sites have stood the test of time. Visitors come from all over the world to visit them.
Whether it's the legendary Shaolin Temple with its martial arts, the calm White Horse Temple, the artistic excellence of Kaiyuan Temple, the peace of Lingyin Temple, or the spiritual significance of Jokhang Temple. Each temple holds a unique place in China's history. They continue to inspire and delight visitors. For those seeking spiritual relief and cultural improvement.

Hatred Quotes: Words to Define the Darkest Corners of Human Emotions

They are windows into the darkest corners of the human soul. 

Hatred Quotes: Words to Define the Darkest Corners of Human Emotions

One of the darkest human emotions is hatred. It is a powerful force that can destroy individuals and societies.

In this article, we have collected some hate quotes to capture their essence.

These words are not just an expression of insult or hatred. They are windows into the darkest corners of the human soul.

A. Hatred Quotes to Define It

-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.meta_description: Baguio City is known as the
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.meta_keywords: Most Haunted Places In Baguio City,Haunted Places In Baguio City,Baguio City
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.content:
5 Most Haunted Places In Baguio City, Philippines, That Will Send Shivers Down Your Spine

Baguio City is a stunning city located in Luzon, Philippines. Known as the "Summer Capital of the Philippines," Baguio City is famous for its cool weather and stunning mountainous views. But beneath the breathtaking scenery and warm hospitality lies a city surrounded by chilling legends and ghostly lore.

5 Most Haunted Places In Baguio City, Philippines, That Will Send Shivers Down Your Spine

In this article, we will dig deeper into this city to uncover the most haunted places in Baguio City.

From a haunted road to an abandoned hotel, these places are surrounded by mysteries that will send shivers down your spine. So get ready to look at the other side of Baguio City that will haunt your dream.

© 2023 trstdly.com

Loakan Road is one of the most popular haunted places in Baguio City. It's a long and winding road that connects the city with the airport.

1. Loakan Road

During the day, you can enjoy the peaceful atmosphere and beautiful views of the forest and mountains from the road. However, as soon as night falls, the atmosphere takes a 180-degree turn.

People believe that Loakan Road is haunted by the White Lady. According to legend, she's the spirit of a beautiful woman who was killed on Loakan Road, and her spirit still haunts the street, seeking revenge for her death.

If you talk to taxi drivers in Baguio City, they will tell you that the White Lady still often appears on Loakan Road, scaring every driver who sees her.

2. Hyatt Terraces Baguio Hotel

The Hyatt Terraces Baguio Hotel was an ex-luxurious hotel. The building has a dark past, which led to the emergence of scary stories surrounding this place.

The Hyatt Terraces Baguio Hotel was opened in 1976. However, the building collapsed when a strong earthquake struck Luzon Island in 1990. At least 50 people died in the hotel during this tragic event.

It's said that the spirit of the victims still haunts the ruin of the hotel today. According to the El Retiro Baguio website, taxi drivers still honk their horns every time they pass the hotel to honor the victims. They said every driver who refuses to honk their horns will see the sighting of a mangled ghost crossing the street.

Sitting on top of the Dominican Hill, the Diplomat Hotel is an abandoned hotel built in 1913. It was originally built as a vacation house for the Dominican Order before being converted into a hotel in 1973. The hotel was closed and abandoned after the death of the owner in the 1980s.

3. The Diplomat Hotel

Today, there are many rumors about the Diplomat Hotel.

Some said that the building is haunted by the ghost of a Japanese soldier who was killed during World War II. People have reported seeing his ghost wandering the hotel at night or hearing him crying.

People also talk about headless nuns haunting the place, making it a spot that's both eerie and fascinating.

4. Teacher's Camp

Teacher's Camp is a very famous spot in Baguio City. Located along Leonard Wood Road, Teacher's Camp is used as a teachers' training center and events venue.

However, the Teacher's Camp also holds the name of one of the most haunted places in Baguio City. The most famous ghost at Teacher's Camp is the White Lady. According to the Amy's Crypt website, it's still not clear who she was. But people have reported seeing the ghost wandering around the facility.

During World War II, The Teacher's Camp was used as a prison by Japanese soldiers. Hundreds of people were held in this prison. They said some prisoners were executed and beheaded in this place. Since then, people have also talked about the appearance of headless ghosts walking around the facility.

5. Laperal Mansion

Laperal Mansion, commonly known as the Laperal White House," is another very famous haunted spot in Baguio City.

The Laperal Mansion is a beautiful white house built by Roberto Laperal in the 1930s.

In 2007, the house was bought by Filipino billionaire Lucio Tan, who opened the house to the public and turned it into a tourist attraction.

According to El Retiro Baguio, the house was used as a garrison for the Japanese soldiers during World War II.

People who were captured by the soldiers were tortured and killed in the house.

There have been many reports of paranormal activity at the Laperal Mansion.

People have reported seeing ghostly figures walking through the mansion, hearing strange noises, and feeling cold spots. Some people have even reported being touched or attacked by ghosts.

45 Funny Family Quotes that Every Family Can Relate To

45 Funny Family Quotes that Every Family Can Relate To

Family is where the best jokes are told, the most embarrassing moments happen, and the most deep are formed. To celebrate this bond, we have compiled 45 funny family quotes, sayings, and jokes. Get ready to smile and giggle as we dive into the world of funny family quotes!

From sibling jokes to parents' witty comments, these funny family quotes are relatable to people of all ages and perfectly capture the essence of family. So, if you need a quote to share on social media or send to your family group, check this out!

Short Funny Family Quotes

1. “Some call it chaos, we call it family.”

2. “My family is temperamental. Half temper, half mental.”

3. “Family is like that annoying itch you can’t scratch.”

4. “The bigger your family, the bigger your problems.”

5. “I was normal two kids ago.”

6. “Being part of a family means smiling for photos.”

7. “Well, that escalated quickly” is our family motto.”

8. “In my family, crazy doesn’t skip a generation.”

9. “Remember as far as anyone knows we’re a nice, normal family.”

10. “Caller ID was invented for family screening.”

11. “Never let an angry sister comb your hair.”

12. “Some family trees bear an enormous crop of nuts.”

13. “Our family is just one tent away from a full-blown Circus.”

14. “We are more than family. We are like a really small gang.”

15. “If you think I’m crazy wait till you meet my family.”

More Funny Family Quotes

1. “The advantage of having only one child is that you always know who did it.”- Erma Bombeck

2. “As a child my family’s menu consisted of two choices: take it or leave it.”- Buddy Hackett

3. “Having a two-year-old is like having a blender that you don’t have the top for.” – Jerry Seinfeld

4. “If you don’t believe in ghosts, you’ve never been to a family reunion.”- Ashleigh Brilliant

5. “Good News: The holidays are about family. Bad News: It has to be your own family.”

6. “I know family comes first, but shouldn’t that mean after breakfast?”- Jeff Lindsay

7. “Children really brighten up a household. They never turn the lights off.”- Ralph Bus

8. “Insanity is hereditary: You can get it from your children.” – Sam Levinson

9. “A family reunion is an effective form of birth control.” – Robert A. Heinlein

10. “I think the family is the place where the most ridiculous and least respectable things in the world go on.”- Ugo Betti

Funny Family Quotes about Siblings

1. “I grew up with six brothers. That’s how I learned to dance—waiting for the bathroom.”—Bob Hope

2. “Sisters never quite forgive each other for what happened when they were five.”—Pam Brown

3. “The highlight of my childhood was making my brother laugh so hard that food came out his nose.” – Garrison Keillor

4. “What strange creatures brothers are!”—Jane Austen

5. “Everyone knows that if you’ve got a brother, you’re going to fight.”—Liam Gallagher

6. “The advantage of growing up with siblings is that you become very good at fractions.”- Robert Brault

7. “Every family has that one crazy person in it. If you’re missing one I seem to have a few extras.”

8. “I smile because you’re my sister. I laugh because there’s nothing you can do about it!”

9. “Siblings: Children of the same parents, each of whom is perfectly normal until they get together.”

10. “When our relatives are at home, we have to think of all their good points or it would be impossible to endure them.”

Funny Family Quotes About Parents

1. "My dad used to say, ‘Always fight fire with fire.’ Which is probably why he got thrown out of the fire brigade.”—Harry Hill

2. “When your mother asks, “Do you want a piece of advice?” it’s a mere formality. It doesn’t matter if you answer yes or no. You’re going to get it anyway.”—Erma Bombeck

3. “It’s not easy being a mom. If it were easy, fathers would do it.”—Betty White

4. “My father had a profound influence on me. He was a lunatic.”—Spike Milligan

5. “Respect your parents. These guys pay for your internet.”—Unknown

6. “Have you ever noticed how parents can go from the most wonderful people in the world to totally embarrassing in three seconds?”—Rick Riordan

7. “It’s especially hard to admit that you made a mistake to your parents, because, of course, you know so much more than they do.”—Sean Covey, “Mother-daughter disagreements were, in hindsight, basically mother stating the truth and daughter taking her own sweet time coming around.”—Barbara Delinsky

8. “No matter how old a mother is, she watches her middle-aged children for signs of improvement.” – Florida Scott-Maxwel

9. “The real menace in dealing with a five-year-old is that in no time at all you begin to sound like a five-year-old.”- Jean Kerr

10. “That time you realize your kids are in bed sleeping yet you’ve been watching The Disney Channel for the past hour by yourself.”

-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.content:
How to Not Throw Up After Drinking Alcohol: 8 Simple Tips

How to Not Throw Up After Drinking Alcohol: 8 Simple Tips

Drinking alcohol can be a fun way to relax and socialize, but it sometimes has unpleasant side effects. One of the most common problems people face is feeling sick and throwing up. Learning how to not throw up after drinking can help make your experience more enjoyable and less uncomfortable.

Throwing up after drinking can happen to anyone, even if they don't drink a lot. There are many reasons why this might happen, and it's important to understand them. Knowing the causes can help you take steps to avoid getting sick in the future.

In this article, we will explore the main reasons why people throw up after drinking alcohol. By understanding these causes, you can better manage your drinking habits and reduce the risk of feeling unwell.

Finally, we will provide practical tips on how to not throw up after drinking. These tips are easy to follow and can make a big difference in how you feel after a night out. We made this guide on Tuesday (21/5/2024).

Throwing up after drinking alcohol is common, and it can happen for several reasons. Understanding these causes can help you avoid feeling sick in the future. Here are the main reasons why people throw up after drinking alcohol:

A. Causes of Throwing Up After Drinking Alcohol

1. Too Much Alcohol: Drinking too much alcohol too quickly can overwhelm your body. When your stomach cannot handle the excess alcohol, it tries to get rid of it by making you throw up. This is your body's way of protecting itself from alcohol poisoning.

2. Empty Stomach: Drinking on an empty stomach can make you more likely to throw up. Food helps absorb alcohol and slows its effects on your body. Without food in your stomach, alcohol goes straight into your bloodstream, making you feel sick faster.

3. Dehydration

Alcohol is a diuretic, which means it makes you pee more often. This can lead to dehydration, making you feel dizzy and nauseous. When you are dehydrated, your body cannot function properly, and this can cause you to throw up.

4. Mixing Drinks: Mixing different types of alcohol or adding sugary mixers can upset your stomach. Different drinks have different ingredients, and combining them can be hard on your digestive system. Sticking to one type of drink can help prevent this problem.

5. Low Tolerance: If you do not drink often, your body might not handle alcohol well. People who rarely drink have a lower tolerance for alcohol, which means they can feel its effects more strongly. This can make them more likely to throw up even after drinking small amounts.

6. Drinking Too Fast

Drinking alcohol quickly does not give your body enough time to process it. When you drink too fast, your blood alcohol level rises quickly, and your body struggles to keep up. This rapid increase can make you feel sick and cause you to throw up.

7. Alcohol Sensitivity: Some people are more sensitive to alcohol than others. This sensitivity can be due to genetics or other health factors. If you are sensitive to alcohol, even small amounts can make you feel sick and cause you to throw up.

8. Irritation of the Stomach Lining: Alcohol is known to irritate the lining of the stomach, leading to inflammation and discomfort. This irritation can trigger the vomiting reflex as a protective mechanism to remove the offending substance.

B. How to Not Throw Up After Drinking Alcohol

1. Pace Yourself: Avoid consuming alcohol too quickly, as it can overwhelm your body, increasing the chances of vomiting. Gradually sip your drink and give your body time to process the alcohol.

2. Choose Wisely: Opt for drinks with a lower alcohol content. Beer and wine generally have lower levels of alcohol compared to spirits, reducing the risk of feeling sick.

3. Stay Hydrated: Alcohol can dehydrate your body, leading to nausea. Sip on water or non-alcoholic beverages in between alcoholic drinks to stay hydrated and decrease the chances of vomiting.

4. Eat Beforehand

A full stomach slows down the absorption of alcohol. Enjoy a balanced meal before drinking, focusing on protein and complex carbohydrates, which can help minimize the impact of alcohol on your stomach.

5. Avoid Mixing

Mixing different types of alcohol can increase the chances of vomiting. Stick to one type of alcoholic beverage throughout the night, as this will make it easier for your body to process.

6. Rest and Relax: Alcohol can irritate your stomach lining, so avoid intense physical activities after consuming alcohol. Allow your body to rest, giving it time to reduce the chances of throwing up.

7. Know Your Limits: Understand how much alcohol you can handle. Everyone has different limits, so listen to your body. If you start to feel dizzy, lightheaded, or nauseous, it's a sign that you should stop drinking.

8. Take Breaks: Take breaks between drinks. This gives your body time to process the alcohol and can help prevent nausea. Use this time to drink water, eat snacks, or simply relax and enjoy the moment.

-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.meta_keywords: how to plunge a toilet,how to unclog a toilet,clogged toilet
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.content:
How to Plunge a Toilet and 5 Other Methods You Can Try

Are you wondering how to plunge a toilet when it gets blocked? A clogged toilet is one of the most common plumbing problems that homeowners face. This situation can be very frustrating, especially when it happens at the worst possible time. Fortunately, there's one simple tool that can help you to deal with it, a plunger.

A plunger works by creating pressure and suction to push or pull the blockage through the toilet drain. When you push the plunger down, it forces water and air toward the clog. When you pull it back up, it creates suction that can help get rid of stuck materials. This simple tool uses basic physics to clear most toilet blockages without calling a plumber.

In this article, we will talk about how to plunge a toilet correctly to help you deal with your blocked toilet. We will also share some other methods you can try to solve the problem and tips to prevent it in the future. We gathered the information from various sources, Monday (23/6/2025).

How to Plunge a Toilet Correctly

Using a plunger might seem simple, but there is a right way to do it for the best results. Follow these steps carefully to clear your clogged toilet safely and effectively.

Step 1: Gather Your Supplies

Before you start, make sure you have the right type of plunger. A flange plunger works best for toilets because it has a rubber flap that creates a better seal in the toilet drain. You will also need rubber gloves, old towels, and a bucket nearby in case of spills.

Step 2: Prepare the Area

Put on your rubber gloves and lay old towels around the toilet base to catch any water that might splash. Turn off the water supply to the toilet by finding the shut-off valve near the base of the toilet. This prevents the toilet from overflowing if the clog is serious.

Step 3: Check the Water Level

If the toilet bowl is too full, you need to remove some water first. Use a small cup or bucket to scoop out excess water until the bowl is about half full. If the water level is too low, add some warm water to cover the plunger head completely.

Step 4: Position the Plunger

Place the plunger head directly over the drain hole at the bottom of the toilet bowl. Make sure the rubber flange is completely inside the drain opening. Push down gently to create a good seal between the plunger and the toilet.

Step 5: Start Plunging

Push the plunger down slowly and steadily, then pull it back up quickly. Repeat this motion 15 to 20 times, keeping the plunger sealed over the drain opening.

Step 6: Test the Results

After plunging, carefully lift the plunger away from the drain. You should see the water level drop if the clog is cleared. Turn the water supply back on and try flushing the toilet. If the water drains normally, the problem is solved.

Step 7: Repeat if Necessary

If the toilet is still clogged, repeat the plunging process. Sometimes it takes several attempts to completely clear a stubborn blockage. Be patient and keep trying the same technique.

Other Methods You Can Try

When plunging does not work, there are several other techniques you can use to clear a toilet clog. These methods use common household items and can be very effective.

Hot Water Method

Pour a bucket of hot water into the toilet bowl from waist height. The force and heat can help break up the clog and push it through the drain. Make sure the water is hot but not boiling, as boiling water can crack the porcelain toilet bowl.

Dish Soap Technique

Squirt several tablespoons of liquid dish soap into the toilet bowl. Let it sit for 20 minutes to help break down grease and waste. Follow this with hot water and then try flushing. The soap works like it does on dirty dishes, breaking apart stuck materials.

Baking Soda and Vinegar Solution

Pour one cup of baking soda into the toilet bowl, followed by one cup of white vinegar. The mixture will fizz and bubble, which can help dissolve the blockage. Wait 30 minutes, then add hot water and try flushing the toilet.

Wire Hanger Snake

Straighten a wire coat hanger and wrap one end with an old cloth. Push this makeshift snake into the drain opening and move it around to break up the clog. Be very careful not to scratch the porcelain with the wire.

Toilet Brush Method

If you have a toilet brush available, you can use it like a small plunger. Push the brush head into the drain opening and move it back and forth to disturb the blockage. This works best for clogs that are close to the surface.

Tips to Prevent Blocked Toilet in the Future

Preventing toilet clogs is much easier than fixing them. These simple habits will help keep your toilet working smoothly and reduce the chance of blockages.

- Watch What You Flush: Only flush toilet paper and human waste down the toilet. Never flush feminine products, baby wipes, cotton balls, dental floss, or paper towels. Even items labeled as "flushable" can cause problems in your plumbing system.

- Use the Right Amount of Toilet Paper: Too much toilet paper at once can create clogs. Use only what you need and consider flushing twice if you need to use a large amount. This prevents the paper from bunching up and blocking the drain.

- Maintain Your Toilet Regularly: Clean your toilet every week to prevent mineral buildup that can narrow the drain opening. Check that all parts are working correctly, including the flapper and flush mechanism. Replace old or damaged parts promptly.

- Address Problems Early: If you notice your toilet draining slowly or making unusual sounds, take action right away. Small problems are much easier to fix than major clogs. Do not wait until the toilet is completely blocked.

- Keep a Plunger Ready: Always have a good quality flange plunger in your bathroom. This simple tool can solve most toilet problems quickly and easily. Store it in a clean, accessible location so you can use it when needed.

- Consider Your Toilet's Age: Older toilets may have weaker flushing power and are more likely to clog. If your toilet is more than 20 years old and clogs frequently, you might want to consider replacing it with a newer, more efficient model.

Creme Brulee Pudding

Sticky Toffee Pudding

40 Harry Potter Trivia Questions To Test Your Knowledge About The Magical World

40 Harry Potter Trivia Questions To Test Your Knowledge About The Magical World

Are you a Harry Potter fan? Do you think you know everything there is to know about the magical world of Harry Potter? Well, it's time to put your knowledge to the test with some Harry Potter trivia questions! Whether you're a die-hard fan or just someone who enjoys the Harry Potter series, these trivia questions are a fun way to challenge yourself and your friends.

Harry Potter trivia questions cover a wide range of topics, from characters and spells to magical creatures and Hogwarts history. Test your knowledge of the Boy Who Lived, his friends, and his many adventures throughout the series.

In this article, we have collected some of the best Harry Potter trivia questions from various sources, Tuesday (20/2/2024).

Are you ready to prove your expertise in all things Harry Potter? Let the trivia begin!

A. Trivia Questions About Harry Potter

1. Question: What is the core material of Harry's wand, and why is it significant? Answer: The core of Harry's wand is a phoenix feather from Fawkes, Dumbledore's phoenix. It's significant because the same phoenix also provided the core for Voldemort's wand, thus connecting Harry and Voldemort in a unique way.

2. Question: What is the name of the house-elf who served the Black family and eventually helped Harry in "Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows"? Answer: Kreacher.

3. Question: What does Harry receive from Hagrid on his eleventh birthday? Answer: A letter of acceptance to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

4. Question: What is the name of the wand shop in Diagon Alley where Harry purchases his wand? Answer: Ollivanders.

5. Question: Who is Harry's godfather? Answer: Sirius Black.

6. Question: What is the name of the spell Harry uses to summon his broomstick? Answer: Accio.
7. Question: Who teaches Harry how to perform the Patronus Charm? Answer: Remus Lupin.

8. Question: What magical artifact does Harry inherit from Dumbledore? Answer: The Golden Snitch from his first Quidditch match, with the words "I open at the close."

9. Question: What position does Harry play on the Gryffindor Quidditch team? Answer: Seeker.

10. Question: What is the name of the village where Harry's parents lived and were killed by Voldemort? Answer: Godric's Hollow.

B. Harry Potter Trivia Questions About Hermione Granger

1. Question: Which spell did Hermione use to fix Harry's glasses during their first meeting on the Hogwarts Express? Answer: Oculus Reparo.

2. Question: What is the name of Hermione's cat? Answer: Crookshanks.

7 Unique Facts About Meerkats, The Joy Inspiration for Timon in The Lion King

7 Unique Facts About Meerkats, The Joy Inspiration for Timon in The Lion King

In the vast deserts where the sun beats down, meerkats hurry about.

They do things that might surprise you. These small animals are familiar to you as the inspiration for Timon in The Lion King. Meerkats have some really cool tricks up their furry sleeves. Explore the magic of these fascinating facts about Meerkats. Get ready for a wild ride as we explore the Meerkat world. Let's uncover the charm and mystery of these desert residents together!

Facts About Meerkats

  • Scientific name: Suricata suricatta
  • Family name: Herpestidae
  • Classification: Mammal
  • Body length: Around 29cm (plus a 19cm tail)
  • Life span (in the wild): 12-14 years
  • Weight: Less than one kilogram
  • Top speed: 32 km/h
  • Diet: Omnivore: Beetles, spiders, caterpillars, and scorpions. They’ll also eat small reptiles, eggs, birds, plants and fruit.
  • Habitat: Desert

Unique Facts About Meerkats

In the dry expanse of the desert, meerkats dance through the sands. It sounds like defying the chances of survival.

1. Meerkats Can Survive Without Drinking in the Desert

Incredibly, these beautiful animals do not drink water. It is a feat that would leave a human hopeless for hydration within days. Meerkats expertly extract all the moisture they need from the insects and grubs included in their diet. This advantage showcases an adaptation that sets Meerkats apart in the animal kingdom.

anggit-rizkianto-unsplash

2. Meerkats are Great Communicators

Meerkats are not only silent desert wanderers; they are fluent communicators. Meerkats have a skill of at least ten different vocalizations. It ranges from murmurs to endangered growls.

They also scold clucks and defensive alarm barks.

These animals weave a sound that paints the landscape with their social dynamics. Females, in particular, take the lead in this vocal symphony. Meerkats create a noise that serves as a protection and a song in the savannah.

Unique Facts About Meerkats

3. Skywatchers and Masters of Vision

The skies above hold the secrets of survival for meerkats.

Ever vigilant against avian dangers, especially birds of prey, meerkats boast extraordinary vision. A meerkat's keen eyes can sense a soaring eagle from more than 1,000 feet away. This quality is proof of their critical awareness and strategic way of living harmoniously in the ever-watchful skies.

In a beautiful twist of nature, meerkats belong to the mongoose family.

4. Venom Doesn't Hurt Meerkats

This family showcases immunity to certain snake venoms. As actual survivors of the desert, they navigate the hazard of venomous bites. It shows a strength that has earned them a reputation as nature's protection against deadly twisting enemies.

Meerkats mark their territories not with traditional limits but with bacteria-infused pastes. These animals use scent bags under their tails.

5. Bacteria Helps Meerkats Mark Their Territory

Their bag design is a unique "paste" that they meticulously spread on rocks and plants.

The complex chemical signals within these scent markers arise from odor-producing bacteria. It creates a typical olfactory signature that represents their territorial limits.

Unique Facts About Meerkats

Beyond their charming exterior lies a surprising truth: Meerkats are highly intelligent beings.

6. The Hidden Intelligence of Timon's Kin

A study conducted at St Andrews University in Scotland discovered the complexity of their coordinated behaviors.

The result tells of meerkat's cognitive mastery that rivals chimpanzees, baboons, dolphins, and even humans. Timon's animated charm is a glimpse into the intellect of these desert philosophers.

Behind the curtain of cuteness, meerkats show their basic instincts in territorial conflicts that can turn deadly.

7. A Meerkat Fight Can Get Serious

In a study spanning over 1,000 animal species, meerkats emerged as the most brutal.

Meerkats have about 20% of meerkat deaths are attributed to territorial conflicts that turned fatal. This dark fact tells us the survival stakes. It drives these adorable animals to engage in extreme battles for their slice of the savannah.

Unique Facts About Meerkats

As we finish looking into the mysterious world of meerkats.

It becomes clear that these animals are more than animated inspirations for beloved characters; they are living proof of strength, intelligence, and the intricate dance of survival in intolerant landscapes.

Unique Facts About Meerkats

Each fact solves their complex existence. These fun facts invite us to appreciate the life of these fantastic inhabitants of the desert.

-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.title: New Dinosaur Species Discovered in Thailand
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.meta_description: New Dinosaur Species Discovered in Thailand. The dinosaur found were young age.
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.content:
New Dinosaur Species Discovered in Thailand

New Dinosaur Species Discovered in Thailand

A new dinosaur species was identified in Thailand thanks to excavating one of Southeast Asia's most well-preserved fossils ever unearthed.

The species is called Minimocursor phunoiensis, which is thought to have lived in the Jurassic period, about 150 million years ago.

Sita Manitkoon of the Center for Palaeontological Research and Education at Mahasarakham University is the head of the excavation study. According to him, this discovery is "very special".

"I'm only 34 years old and I discovered a new dinosaur. It's very, very proud," he said.

Researchers have drawn the dinosaur's appearance based on the information they know, a visualization that combines art and science.

The bones found made it easy for researchers to describe the shape of the dinosaur. But they have to guess the color of the species.

Although the researchers' illustrations look real, these dinosaurs' actual shape and color could be much different. This is a view of Minimocursor phunoiensis taken from a documentary uploaded on YouTube.

In a study, researchers said the fossil was a "well-defined skeleton" and "one of the most complete dinosaurs ever found in Southeast Asia."

"This is one of the most complete skeletons," said Dr Manitkoon.

Based on the size of the bones, researchers think the dinosaurs were young. They estimated it was about 60 centimeters long, about the size of a medium-sized dog. But the adult version of this dinosaur could have been much bigger.

"We estimate that in adulthood, this dinosaur could have reached two meters, based on the longest bones found," the researchers wrote.

Researchers found this species in Phu Noi, Kalasin province in Thailand. The researchers described this location as a "small hill" filled with bones in their study.

"The Phu Noi area contains many specimens."

Top 6 Places to Visit in Marseille: Exploring the Mediterranean Charm of France

Top 6 Places to Visit in Marseille: Exploring the Mediterranean Charm of France

Marseille is a vibrant city in the south of France, known for its rich history, beautiful architecture, and stunning waterfront views. With a mix of old-world charm and modern amenities, Marseille is a must-visit destination for travelers looking to experience the beauty of the Mediterranean coast.

From historic landmarks to picturesque neighborhoods, Marseille has something for everyone to explore and enjoy. Here are the top 6 places to visit in Marseille:

Perched high on a hill overlooking the city, Notre-Dame de la Garde is an iconic basilica in Marseille.

1. Notre-Dame de la Garde

The stunning church is known for its ornate interior, beautiful mosaics, and breathtaking views of the city and the Mediterranean Sea. Visitors can climb the steps from the foot of the hill to reach the basilica and enjoy the panoramic view of the city from up there.

Le Panier is Marseille's oldest neighborhood and a charming place to explore. Wander through narrow, winding streets lined with colorful houses, cafes, and boutiques.

2. Le Panier

Le Panier is also home to several art galleries, street art, and historic buildings, making it a great spot for history buffs and art enthusiasts.

3. Abbaye Saint-Victor

Founded in the 5th century, Abbaye Saint-Victor is a historic abbey located near the Old Port of Marseille. The abbey features a beautiful church with Romanesque architecture, as well as a crypt where visitors can see ancient tombs and archaeological remains.

The peaceful atmosphere and stunning architecture make Abbaye Saint-Victor a must-visit in Marseille.

4. Museum of European and Mediterranean Civilization

Housed in a striking modern building overlooking the sea, the Museum of European and Mediterranean Civilization (MuCEM) is a cultural hub in Marseille.

The museum showcases the history, art, and traditions of the Mediterranean region through a diverse collection of artifacts, exhibits, and interactive displays.

Visitors can learn about the rich cultural heritage of Marseille and the Mediterranean at MuCEM.

© 2024 trstdly.com

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Mucem (@mucem_officiel)

Just a short drive from Marseille, Calanques National Park is a natural paradise of rugged cliffs, crystal-clear waters, and hidden coves. The park is perfect for outdoor enthusiasts, offering hiking trails, rock climbing, and swimming opportunities.

5. Calanques National Park

Visitors can explore the stunning Calanques by boat or on foot, taking in the breathtaking scenery and wildlife along the way.

6. Château d'If

Located on a tiny island just off the coast of Marseille, Château d'If is a historic fortress and former prison made famous by Alexandre Dumas's novel "The Count of Monte Cristo."

Visitors can take a short boat ride to the island and explore the fortress, prison cells, and panoramic views of the Mediterranean. Château d'If offers a fascinating glimpse into Marseille's history and literary heritage.

Singaporean Woman Dies in Go-Karting Accident

She was killed in a go-karting accident in Batam while on a birthday celebration trip.

Singaporean Woman Dies in Go-Karting Accident

A 33-year-old Singaporean woman died while driving a go-kart in Batam, Indonesia.

This incident happened on February 21. According to Berita Harian, the woman is Arini Mohamed Adinan.

The incident happened at Golden City Go Kart in Bengkong around 15.30 Indonesian time.

Arini is a woman who works in the logistics industry. She was in Batam with her friends on February 20-22 to celebrate her birthday.

This second of three child died the day after her birthday.

The incident

The victim was reportedly riding a go-kart with the number 14 on it.

She had made two laps before crashing at high speed into a barrier.

The witness, who works at the venue, then approached her.

According to him, her helmet had been pulled off. Her long hair was wrapped around and stuck on her drive-kart.

She was then rushed to a clinic. Unfortunately, she reportedly died there. The local police are currently investigating the case.

Arini lives with her mother and stepfather in Chinatown.

Mohamed Redzwan, her brother, said, "We were very shocked and sad when we heard the news."

"We don't know where he is in Batam. The last time we saw him was on Tuesday when I came home from work, and he left the house at 1pm."

trstdly © 2024    

Police Commissioner Zahwani Pandra Arsyad, head of public relations for the Riau Islands regional police, stated to The Straits Times.

"The victim had long hair down to her waist. Some of her hair was ripped from her scalp."

Arini's body was brought back to Singapore on February 22. 

Md Akbar International Islamic Caskets handled the transfer and funeral arrangements.

The funeral was held on the evening of February 22, reports Straits Times.

5 Most Haunted Places In North Dakota to Bring You to The Best Nightmare

North Dakota is home to numerous sites steeped in eerie tales. North Dakota has several haunted locations that can send chills down your spine. Some spooky and mysterious occurrences are perfect for those seeking a thrilling adventure.

The state's haunted places offer a glimpse into its rich history, often intertwined with ghostly legends and paranormal activities. From abandoned hospitals to historic buildings, these locations promise to deliver an unforgettable and haunting experience. Here, we present the six most haunted places in North Dakota that will bring you to the best nightmare. Prepare yourself for an exploration of the unknown, where every corner holds a whisper of the past and a hint of the supernatural.

1. The Children's Museum at Yunker Farm, Fargo

Once a vibrant children's museum, Yunker Farm is now known for its eerie atmosphere. Visitors have reported strange occurrences, such as doors opening and closing on their own and seeing a ghostly little girl near the well.

The farmhouse, dating back to 1876, adds to the unsettling charm of this location.

Where to Visit: Yunker Farm is located in Fargo, and while the museum has closed, the gardens and playground remain open to the public.


2. St. Joseph's Hospital, Dickinson

This former hospital has a reputation for being haunted by the spirits of former patients. patients. Staff and visitors have experienced strange noises and unexplained feelings of being watched.

The building's history as a medical facility adds to its ghostly tales.

Where to Visit: St. Joseph's Hospital is in Dickinson, though access may be limited as it is no longer operational.

3. North Dakota State University, Fargo

NDSU is not only known for its academic programs but also for its haunted buildings. Ceres Hall and Minard Hall are particularly infamous, with reports of flickering lights and strange presences felt by students.

These eerie experiences make the campus a hotspot for ghost hunters.

Where to Visit: North Dakota State University is located in Fargo and is accessible to the public.


4. Old Armory, Williston

The Old Armory in Williston has a long history and is rumored to be haunted by soldiers from the past.  Visitors have reported hearing footsteps and voices in the empty halls.

Haunted Places In North Dakota

Some creepy experiences create a chilling atmosphere that attracts paranormal enthusiasts.

Where to Visit: The Old Armory is in Williston, and while it may not be open for tours, its exterior can be viewed.

5. San Haven Sanatorium, Dunseith

Once a tuberculosis sanatorium, San Haven is now abandoned. This site is filled with ghostly legends. Many believe the spirits of ex-patients linger in the halls. 

Paranormal studies have reported strange noises and sightings, making it a must-visit for thrill-seekers.


Where to Visit: San Haven Sanatorium is located in Dunseith and can be explored, but caution is advised due to its neglected state.


These haunted places in North Dakota glimpse the eerie side of history. Are you a believer in the supernatural or just looking for a thrill? These spots promise to deliver a memorable experience. Happy ghost hunting!

-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.title: How To Tell If Your Dog Is Pregnant At Home or Just Fat
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.meta_description: You might sometimes wonder about your pet's health and condition if you're a dog owner.
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.content:
How To Tell If Your Dog Is Pregnant At Home or Just Fat

Always prioritize your dog's health and well-being, and don't hesitate to seek a professional. (Photo by Canine Comfort Care on StockCake)

How To Tell If Your Dog Is Pregnant At Home or Just Fat

You might sometimes wonder about your pet's health and condition if you're a dog owner.

One common question is how to tell if your dog is pregnant or gaining weight. This article will provide 12 signs and tips on telling if your dog is pregnant. Knowing how to tell if your dog is pregnant will help you indicate between pregnancy and weight gain. Let's check it out!

1. Changes in appetite:

A pregnant dog's eating habits often change. In the early stages of pregnancy, some dogs may experience a decreased appetite. However, as pregnancy progresses, their appetite typically increases. It could be a sign of pregnancy if you notice significant changes in your dog's eating habits.

2. Weight gain:

While weight gain alone isn't a definitive sign of pregnancy, it's often one of the first noticeable changes. Pregnant dogs usually gain weight gradually for their pregnancy. If you observe a steady increase in your dog's weight, especially around the midsection, it might indicate pregnancy.

3. Enlarged nipples:

As a dog's body prepares for nursing, her nipples may become larger and more pronounced. This change usually occurs 2-3 weeks after conception. The nipples may also darken in color. However, it's important to note that dogs with previous litters might always have enlarged nipples.

4. Behavioral changes:

Pregnant dogs often experience mood swings and behavioral changes. They may become more affectionate and clingy, or conversely, they might seek more alone time. Some dogs may display nesting behaviors, such as gathering blankets or toys. These changes can be subtle, so pay close attention to your dog's behavior.

5. Morning sickness:

Just like humans, dogs can experience morning sickness during pregnancy. This usually occurs around 3-4 weeks into pregnancy. If you notice your dog vomiting or showing signs of nausea, particularly in the morning, it could be a sign of pregnancy. However, vomiting can also indicate other health issues, so it's best to consult a veterinarian.

6. Increased tiredness:

Pregnancy can make dogs feel more tired than usual. If you notice your normally energetic dog becoming lethargic or sleeping more often, it might be due to pregnancy. However, increased tiredness can also be a sign of various health issues, so monitoring other symptoms is important.

7. Swollen belly:

Your dog's belly will swell as the pregnancy progresses. This usually becomes noticeable around the 4-5 week mark. The abdomen will continue to expand as the puppies grow. However, a swollen belly can also be caused by other factors, such as weight gain or certain health conditions.

8. Clear vaginal discharge:

Clear, odorless vaginal discharge is normal during pregnancy. This usually occurs around 4-5 weeks into pregnancy. If you notice any discharge that is colored or has an unpleasant odor, it's essential to consult a veterinarian, as it could indicate an infection.

9. Decreased physical activity:

Pregnant dogs often become less active as their pregnancy progresses. They may show less interest in playing or going for long walks. This decrease in activity is normal as the dog's body is working hard to support the growing puppies.

10. Visible puppy movement:

In the later stages of pregnancy, usually around 50 days after conception, you might see or feel the puppies moving inside your dog's belly. This can be an exciting and clear sign of pregnancy. However, it's essential to be gentle when feeling puppy movement to avoid causing discomfort to your dog.

11. Changes in body shape:

As pregnancy progresses, you may notice changes in your dog's body shape. The waistline may become less defined, and the abdomen may appear more rounded. These changes are due to the growing of puppies and the expansion of the uterus.

12. Professional confirmation:

While these signs can help you determine if your dog might be pregnant, the most accurate way to confirm pregnancy is through professional methods. A veterinarian can perform various tests to confirm pregnancy.

- Palpation: Around day 28 of pregnancy, a vet can gently feel your dog's abdomen to detect the presence of puppies.
- Ultrasound: This can detect puppies as early as 25-35 days into pregnancy.

X-ray: While not typically used until later in the pregnancy (around day 45), an X-ray can confirm pregnancy and help determine the number of puppies.

Remember, many of these signs can also indicate other health conditions or weight gain. If you doubt your dog might be pregnant, it's always best to consult for a professional diagnosis. They can provide you with the most accurate information.

Veterinarians also guide you on how to care for your pregnant dog if it is confirmed.


By being observant and aware of these signs, you'll be better equipped to tell if your dog is pregnant or just experiencing weight gain. Always prioritize your dog's health and well-being, and don't hesitate to seek a professional.

In today's digital age, social media has become integral to our daily lives. While it can be an excellent tool for connecting with others and sharing experiences, extreme social media use also has a dark side.


Several movies have highlighted the negative effects of social media addiction. These films shed light on the dangers and consequences of being too consumed by online platforms. Here are five movies that explore the dark side of social media addiction:

  • Rotten Tomatoes: 92%

  • Genre: Thriller/Drama

It is a drama that intertwines multiple storylines about the consequences of excessive internet and social media use. It highlights how it can lead to isolation and disconnection from those around us. It is available to rent or buy on YouTube.

The portrayal of social media addiction in these films is a stark reminder of the dangers that come with being too engaged in the online world.

These movies present cautionary tales about the dangers of social media addiction. They show the terrible effects it can have on our mental health, relationships, and overall well-being. They remind us to be mindful of our online habits and to prioritize real-life connections over virtual ones.

Consider taking a break and watching these films to understand the dark side of social media. Remember, moderation is essential when using technology, so let's strive for a healthy balance in our digital lives. Happy watching!

Krasinski has made strategic real estate investments alongside his wife, actress Emily Blunt. He buys and sells high-value properties in Los Angeles and Brooklyn, enhancing their overall wealth.

-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.title: 8 Most Beautiful Countries in South America
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.meta_description: 8 Most Beautiful Countries in South America; more than just Argentina and Brasil!
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.meta_keywords: 8 Most Beautiful Countries in South America
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.content:
8 Most Beautiful Countries in South America

8 Most Beautiful Countries in South America

South America is a beautiful continent with many amazing countries to visit. From the tall Andes Mountains to the green Amazon Rainforest, there is so much to see. Let us take you to eight of the most beautiful countries in South America through this article; each with special destinations to offer, like big waterfalls, colorful cities, and lots of different animals and plants. 

Argentina

Explore the magnificent Iguazu Falls, the rugged Patagonia region, and enjoy the vibrant city of Buenos Aires, known as the "Paris of South America."

Bolivia

Witness the unique Salar de Uyuni salt flats, the colorful Laguna Verde, and the majestic Andean peaks, offering some of South America's most enchanting landscapes.

Brazil

Immerse yourself in the Amazon Rainforest, relax on Rio de Janeiro's picturesque beaches, and visit the Pantanal, the world's largest tropical wetland, rich in flora and fauna.

Chile

Discover snow-capped Andes, breathtaking Patagonian fjords, and the world's driest desert, Atacama, perfect for stargazing.

Colombia

Experience the colorful culture and colonial charm of Cartagena and admire the stunning Andean mountain range.

Ecuador

Explore the diverse Galapagos Islands, home to unique wildlife, trek the Andean highlands, and discover the treasure trove of biodiversity.

Peru

Visit the ancient Inca city of Machu Picchu, marvel at the stunning color of Vinicunca peaks, and experience the diverse haven for countless plant and animal species.

Venezuela

Be amazed by the world's tallest waterfall, Angel Falls, the stunning Los Roques Archipelago, and the vast Gran Sabana region, featuring unique tepui table-top mountains.

-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.title: 6 Fun Things To Do In Waikiki, Hawaii With Kids
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.meta_description: From swimming at the Waikiki Beach to learning history in Pearl Harbor, here are some fun things to do in Waikiki for kids.
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.meta_keywords: Things To Do In Waikiki,Places To Visit In Waikiki,Waikiki
-- Batch 13 (sisa 181 baris terakhir)\r\.content:
6 Fun Things To Do In Waikiki, Hawaii With Kids

Looking for some fun places to visit in Hawaii with the kids? Look no further than Waikiki, a paradise destination known for its beautiful beaches and endless activities.

6 Fun Things To Do In Waikiki, Hawaii With Kids

There are so many things to do in Waikiki that you and your family will never be bored. From playing in the sand to exploring the underwater world, there's something for everyone in this tropical wonderland.

In this article, we will explore some great and fun things to do in Waikiki with kids, according to various sources, Monday (11/12/2023). These activities will surely make your family journey an unforgettable memory. So, grab your sunscreen and get ready for a memorable family adventure in this Hawaiian paradise.

Waikiki Beach is one of the most famous beaches in Honolulu, Hawaii. It has soft, sandy shores and calm, warm waters, making it a popular destination for families.

1. Enjoy A Relaxing Time At The Famous Waikiki Beach

Waikiki Beach

Visiting Waikiki Beach with kids can be a great experience. The beach offers plenty of activities that are perfect for children, such as building sandcastles and swimming. There are also nearby parks and playgrounds for kids to enjoy when they need a break from the sun and sand.

Waikiki Beach

Overall, Waikiki Beach is a wonderful destination for families with kids. The combination of beautiful scenery, calm waters, and plenty of activities make it a great place to relax and have fun with the whole family.

Diamond Head Hike is a popular hiking trail in Hawaii, known for its breathtaking views of Waikiki and the Pacific Ocean. The trail takes hikers up to the summit of Diamond Head Crater, where you can see for miles around.

2. Hiking At The Famous Diamond Head Trail

Diamond Head

Hiking at the Diamon Head can be a great activity for families with older kids. The hike is relatively short, about 1.6 miles round trip, but it is steep in some parts. The trail is well-maintained and offers stunning panoramic views, making it a rewarding experience for hikers of all ages.

Overall, Diamond Head Hike can be a great adventure for families with older kids who enjoy outdoor activities and are up for a bit of a challenge.

3. Learn The History At Pearl Harbor

Pearl Harbor is a place in Hawaii that has a lot of historical significance. It is where a surprise attack took place on December 7, 1941, during World War II. This event led to the United States joining the war.

Pearl Harbor

Visiting Pearl Harbor can be a good educational experience for kids. They can learn about the history of the place, the events of that fateful day, and the impact it had on the world. There are museums, memorials, and even the opportunity to see real-life artifacts from the war.

Overall, visiting Pearl Harbor can be a great activity for families. It offers a meaningful journey that combines learning with a shared experience, allowing families to gain insights into the impact of the past on our present.

4. Visit Honolulu Zoo

When your family is in Waikiki, a visit to Honolulu Zoo is a must. Located in the heart of Waikiki, it offers a fun and educational experience for the whole family.

The zoo is home to a wide variety of animals from all over the world, including elephants, giraffes, monkeys, and more. Visitors can learn about different species and their habitats while enjoying a leisurely stroll through the beautifully landscaped grounds.

In addition to seeing animals, the Honolulu Zoo also offers interactive experiences, such as the morning safari tour. There are also educational programs and special events that cater to younger visitors.

5. Visit The Waikiki Aquarium

Waikiki Aquarium is another great place to learn more about the animals that inhabit our planet in Waikiki. It's a very popular attraction that offers a unique opportunity to learn about marine life in a fun and interactive way.

The aquarium features a wide variety of marine animals, including colorful fish, mesmerizing jellyfish, and captivating corals. Visitors can also experience hands-on exhibits and educational programs that cater to people of all ages.

Overall, the Waikiki Aquarium is a fantastic destination for families with kids, offering a blend of entertainment and education that caters to all ages. It's a great place to visit to learn about the wonders of the ocean and its inhabitants.

6. Learn Hawaii's History At Iolani Palace

Iolani Palace is a historic building located in downtown Honolulu, Hawaii. It was once the official residence of Hawaii's monarchy and is now a popular tourist attraction.

Iolani Palace

Visiting Iolani Palace with kids can be a great way for them to learn about Hawaii's history. The palace offers guided tours that are both educational and engaging, giving visitors a glimpse into the lives of Hawaii's royalty. Kids can learn about the unique culture and traditions of the Hawaiian people, as well as the fascinating history of the island kingdom.

The palace grounds also offer a beautiful and serene setting for families to explore and enjoy. With its stunning architecture and lush gardens, Iolani Palace provides a perfect backdrop for a family outing.
